grievance_claim: Student claims 68.5% attendance with medical certificate for 15 days hospitalization due to dengue fever
decision_reason_summary: Attendance below UGC-mandated 75% minimum. Medical certificate covers only 15 days but attendance is 6.5% below threshold requiring 20+ days coverage

grievance_claim: Request revaluation of Power Systems exam. Scored 45/100 which is 5 marks below passing. Result declared 8 days ago
decision_reason_summary: Within 15-day revaluation deadline as per UGC regulations. Fee payment required

grievance_claim: Exactly 75% attendance. Requesting confirmation of eligibility for semester exam
decision_reason_summary: Meets UGC minimum 75% attendance requirement exactly. Eligible for semester examination

grievance_claim: 74.9% attendance due to family emergency (father hospitalization). No medical certificate for student
decision_reason_summary: Attendance 0.1% below UGC 75% threshold. Family emergency documentation does not constitute valid medical excuse for student

grievance_claim: SC category student with family income Rs 145000 per year. Requesting full fee waiver
decision_reason_summary: Meets RTE Act 2009 criteria for SC category with income below Rs 200000. Full fee waiver approved

decision_reason_summary: UGC national regulation (75%) supersedes university policy (70%). L1 authority takes precedence over L3
